FOSS IoW Council

An Open Source Goverment Initiative of the Isle of WIght

Current GIS solutions

Currently the Isle of Wight Council uses a number of proprietary tools for common Geographical Information System related tasks such as data visualization and mapping. The current tools require a large amount of financial resources. The IoW Council challanges the current setup and investigates the possibilties to improve the situation. Find out more about the current technologies:

The Open-source initative

In 2017 a new initiative was accepted that intends to move the current infrastructure to a free and open-source technology based solution. This task requires a thorough investigation of available GIS tools. The possibilties are endless and the open-source, community based approach proposes many advantages, including the obvious financial benefits. Find out more about the current technologies:

The purpose of the project

The aim of this website is to showcase the current GIS technology used by the Isle of Wight Council to communicate GIS realted information to the general public and to present a possible solution for undertaking the same task with free and open-source solutions.

Open-source Initiative

Why choose open-source?

Community

Using Open-source software enables a truly community driven solution for the island.

More info

Cost efficiency

Free and open-source solutions lower the costs significantly. Some support fees might still apply.

More info

Flexibility

The open-source world ensures a high level of customizability. This provides more relevant solutions.

More info

Created with the Jekyll static site generator, written in the Ruby programming language. The site generation is implemented in the Liquid template language. Hosted on Github Pages, the layout is based on Bootstrap and jQuery and inspired by the Clean blog Bootstrap theme by David Miller.
